label: Petition from Jean Morrison to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Jean Morrison to the St. Andrew's Society seeking assistance for herself and her child after her husband's death.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Jean Morrison to the St. Andrew's Society seeking assistance for herself and her child after her husband's death.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the Members of the St. Andrews Club met at Charleston the 30th November 1754 being the Anniversary Meeting

Jean Morrison widow

Humbly Sheweth

That your Petitioner has for some time past Laboured under great want partly Occasioned by the Sickness of your Petitioners Husband late deceased and partly by having a Child to Support, which has Reduced your Petitioner to the meanest Circumstances and uncapable [incapable] to Support herself or Child without that Assistance of Charitable and well Disposed Christians That your Petitioner's late deceased Husband had been for a very Considerable time before his death Sick and Confined to his Bed by means whereof your Petitioner was obliged to Sell Sundry things belonging to her for his Support

May it therefore Please the worthy members to Consider the Low Circumstances of your Petitioner and Child And bestow and Grant Such Relief as to them Shall Seem proper And as in Duty Bound your Petition Shall Every pray etc

30th Nov 1754

	her
Jean	X	Morrison
	mark
